title: Number of cats in the U.S. 2000 to 2017
summary: This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Number of cats in millions, with a total of 9 data points. The chart has 7 significant trends.
The longest trend is extremely positive which exists from 2004 to 2000.
In a similar manner, the next significant trend is extremely positive which exists from 2017 to 2015.
Correspondingly, the next significant trend is slightly negative which exists from 2015 to 2013.
Differently, the next significant trend is extremely positive which exists from 2013 to 2011.
In a similar manner, the next significant trend is moderately negative which exists from 2011 to 2008.
On the other hand, the next significant trend is extremely positive which exists from 2008 to 2006.
Additionally, the next significant trend is moderately negative which exists from 2006 to 2004.
gold: According to a national pet owners survey , there was a total of approximately 95.6 million cats living in households in the United States in 2017 . In the same year , some 68 percent of all U.S. households owned at least one pet . Increasing pet expenditure Whilst the number of households owning cats , and pets in general , has remained relatively consistent over the last few years , pet industry expenditure has steadily grown .
